etymologies: mid 18th century: from French, diminutive of rose (see rose)

definitions: a rose-shaped decoration, typically made of ribbon and awarded to winners of a competition

examples.text: the showjumping rosettes Samantha had accumulated

shortDefinitions: rose-shaped decoration worn by supporters of sports team or political party

definitions: a design, arrangement, or growth resembling a rose.
a carved or molded ornament resembling or representing a rose

examples.text: some stone friezes carved with rosettes

shortDefinitions: carved or moulded ornament resembling or representing rose

definitions: a marking or group of markings resembling a rose

examples.text: on the greater part of the body the spots are grouped in rosettes

shortDefinitions: marking or group of markings resembling rose

definitions: a radial arrangement of horizontally spreading leaves at the base of a low-growing plant

examples.text: a large rosette of basal leaves

shortDefinitions: radial arrangement of horizontally spreading leaves at base of low-growing plant

examples.text: three large round rosettes put together using table cut diamonds set in silvered gold
